attributes.comment:
While I understand the need to increase revenue within US-CIS, the undue burden
placed on adoptive parents by this 66% fee increase outweighs the benefits.
Adoptive parents spend years in the pursuit of a family. Infertility is the primary
reason many families choose to adopt abroad, and often by the time the decision
to adopt is reached, finances are strained. If we truly value the American family,
why are we making it so much more difficult, even unattainable in some cases, for
families to be formed through international adoption?

I would be happy to share out fertility and adoption story, and the joy our now 13
month old son has brought to our lives, if it will assist in striking down this unfair
increase in fees. I find it unconscionable that because we have to jump through
so many hoops and file so much paperwork, the cost to provide him with an
official piece of paper saying he is a citizen is going to more than double before I
can finish the process. Our dreams of completing our family with a sibling for him
may be out of reach if these fee increases continue.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Jennifer C. Ryan
